revised_title: Carbonate of Lime in Sea-Water and Its Relation to Land Proximity
tldr: The author investigates the presence of carbonate of lime in sea-water and finds that its concentration is higher near coasts and in shallow waters. This discovery supports the idea that carbonate of lime is deposited from sea-water in these areas, contributing to the formation of sandstone. The author also discusses the implications of these findings for steam navigation and suggests further research on the proportion of sulfate of lime in different parts of the ocean.
